text: Daniel Little McFadden (born July 29, 1937) is an American econometrician. He won the 2000 Nobel Memorial Prize in Economic Sciences with James Heckman. He won the prize "for his development of theory and methods for analyzing discrete choice". He is the Presidential Professor of Health Economics at the University of Southern California and Professor of the Graduate School at University of California, Berkeley. ==References== Category:1937 births Category:Living people Category:American economists Category:Scientists from North Carolina Category:People from Raleigh, North Carolina
title: Daniel McFadden
